conclusion: The distance traveled by the car can be calculated by finding the area under the velocity-time graph.
From the acceleration graph, determine the velocity at different time intervals.
From 0 to 10 seconds, the acceleration is 2 m/s².
The velocity at 10 seconds is 20 m/s.
From 10 to 30 seconds, the acceleration is 0 m/s².
The velocity remains constant at 20 m/s from 10 to 30 seconds.
From 30 to 60 seconds, the acceleration is -1 m/s².
The velocity at 60 seconds is -10 m/s.
Calculate distance from 0 to 10 seconds: 100 m.
Calculate distance from 10 to 30 seconds: 400 m.
Calculate distance from 30 to 60 seconds: 150 m.
The total distance traveled is 650 meters.
